Genuinely fun action romp, had a great time watching.
Loved this movie. As did my 11 year old daughter. Alicia is superb.

This film is better than the original Angelina Jolie ones,,, thats partly because Alicia Vikander is a more believable performer and is allowed to be more human and vulnerable than Jolie was... but also the storyline is slightly more grounded... It's not a great movie but its entertaining and thats whats important.

Is a fresh face for the Tomb Raider and it was good departure from the ways it was done when Angelina Jolie was at the helm of the character , and honestly is was a impressive movie that had mix of a 007 movie with tidbits of mission impossible and Indiana Jones films , and hopefully we can get a sequel to expand on the character with a new actress

Tomb Raider's star Alicia Vikander goes all in, and is helped by a story that is surprisingly, almost as agile as she is. There is no glitz or glam here to elevate the film, and the audience can decide for themselves if that is a good thing or a bad thing. What Tomb Raider is sure to do is satisfy the masses with a blockbuster that for once has a story and protagonist that feel fully real and realized. The movie sports an admirable and diverse supporting cast, but they just can't compete with the star's incredible lead performance, not that they don't give it a nice try.
Absolutely fantastic film. Enjoyed this alot more than the yawn fest that was black panther. What are critics on these days.

This critic score is another example of why audiences shouldn't trust critics anymore. They gave their endorsement to Last Jedi, which was pretty terrible, and then they slap a 50% on this film, which in my opinion was very good. The action was great, the plot was enthralling, and there was nothing glaringly wrong with the movie. Really don't know why the critics were so upset by it. Highly recommend!

I enjoyed the film a lot! Filled with fun, edge-of-your-seat action scenes, an interesting and fresh take on Lara. Alicia killed it, she's always a delight to watch on screen and have this magnetism about her, you can't take your eyes of her!

Great reboot of the franchise! Following the star power of Jolie is tough enough, but Vikander's adaptation of the role as a young beginner is "sooper". She invested time, effort, acting on this movie and it showed! We love the cliff hangers, more natural. We like the plot, and that it took pieces from the game with more natural EFX!... nothing relevant here, but I felt watching this the second time - a feeling I didn't get from Star Wars The Last Jedi. That SW TLJ movie was dumb. This LC Tomb Raider by Vikander ROCKS!!! Kudos to the director for getting this right!

Tomb Raider is an enjoyable rebooted movie with some good adventure/action moments. There are lot of deja-vus and for me one the main one was Indiana Jones raiders of the lost ark. The special effects are sometimes good and sometimes ok. Overall fun!
It is an impressing movie with the stunning performance of Vikander. It is the best movie in March.
Loved it! Had so much fun watching this movie and would highly recommend!

The movie is actually decent, respect source material from video games, adding some plot twist that somehow managed better than the video games. Although, lacking of the ruins, myth or the feeling of "Japan" of Yamatai Island, and some confusing plots. The whole film is really well done with solid acting, solid action sequences, nice puzzles and the final tomb is good. I really love it. Great movie, great video game adaptation.
Bland and boring. Very poor ending with no real excitement
Stop trying to make sprout happen....lame

it was fantastic, i loved it, felt like I played a whole video game in a two hour slot,and lots of challenges from the first games in there. I loved how the movie didn't directly jump into the wild, starts off with life in London, and very happy with the fox race. It gives it more as a film. Very impressed with how they did it, think it'll open up the franchise to people who have never played it before too, just a great stand alone film, but also good for existing fans. very happy

Lara croft being one of the most famous women adventurers in gaming, highly sexualised with an urealistic body image for some men to drool over, and video game films flopping over the years with awful scripts and terrible likeness of the characters. The new 2018 Tomb Raider film was an absolute fun mix of plot, character development, action, adventure, puzzle solving and quite an intimidating villain which I had my doubts about but he actually pulled it off really well and made me feel quite uncomfortable as he was really menacing, especially how villains in a lot of films these days are quite forgettable and not worth mentioning. The most important part is Alicia as Lara croft, she owned the role particularly well, she's a young, fit and tough woman who showed a badass but humanised and grounded Lara croft and held her own until the very end of the film. The story was well written and held closely to the 2013 game reboot story and cinematography with changes here and there, but it was the Lara croft of the 1990s and that's all that matters as it's sticking to source material. If you're in this film for tits and ass, go home and rethink your life because this film is for intellectuals who can think with their upstairs brain. SEQUEL PLEASE!
A massive leap from the Angelina Jolie era of Tomb Raider, it is a must see movie regardless of reviews, this will satisfy gamers.

This movie is definitely an big improvement in the video game genre. It stayed as true as possible to the game it was based on. Alicia Vikander is for sure the stand out in this movie. And brings you a female badass, that has also a lot more humanity and depth to her then the previous Lara. She nails that role and I couldn't get enough of her. The Action and the CGI was fine too. The only big thing the movie was lacking is an inspiring and original story. It felt a little worn out. But all in all a big step in the right direction and a really enjoyable time at the theater.

Needed a less generic paint by the picture story and villain. Great effects, action sequences and a brutal effort by Alicia Vikander. Very true to the rebooted tomb raider games, and maybe a it too faithful.
Loved the games and loved the movie. Great action, drama, touch of comedy. Felt like a realistic adaptation. You don't have to have played the game and enjoy it.

Yay! I really liked it!Casting for the movie was perfect, Walton Goggins makes for the perfect villain. Alicia Vikander made a perfect Lara. Storyline was slightly different ( but a few on par stuff) from the game but not surprised as they have to cram a lot of storyline in a 2 hours movie. The end did set it up for way more storyline in future movies, so I'm stoked to see where it goes.Fantastic job on graphics, scenery and props matching the game.Really fun and worth seeing.

Walmart:Screen protectorPaintbrushesBlack, gold, white, and purple paintMaple bacon seasoningDr. PepperAldi/Kroger:PizzaCoffee creamerLg Ziplock bagsBreadChickenDish SoapChipsMayoSpongesPepperBell pepperLettuceEggsKleenexI was highly skeptical going into this movie, but it performed so above and beyond what I had imagined. Gone is the over-sexualized Laura Croft of Jolie's run. Alicia Vikander is perfect. While she's beautiful, she proves that female action stars don't need to be oversexualized to be entertaining.As a fan of the video games, I was so pleased. The movie was written tightly, and Vikander shines as Laura. It's a treat that we see her develop over the course of the movie into the Tomb Raider, rather than crash onto the scene as such. I'm excited to see where the movie franchise goes. My only critiques are that I wish the tombs had been a little more detailed, and there needed to be more supernatural elements surrounding the tombs. I won't say more on the last, as spoilers would surely follow. All in all, a great franchise reboot.
amazing. best adaptation of game ever made

all myths are foundations of reality..Tomb RaiderEven though there are stunning graphic visuals (all the water based sequences are beautifully shot), goosefleshing sound effects, brutal action sequences and jaw dropping stunts (hats off to the stuntmen) ironically the choreography; in a feature like this that relies a lot upon such stuff, is petty and questionable which at a certain point turns depressing rather than frustrating. At this stage of cinema, one would assume that the remake or the updated version of any feature or tale would be created with an aim to surpass the predecessor and fulfill the limitations (one is wrong). The premise never had enough potential to bedazzle the audience in the first place but in here the director Roar Uthaug is not even convincing the audience for a second look. Alicia Vikander, at the heart of it is so good and genuine throughout the course of it that it aches you to watch a talent go waste by. Tomb Raider has a shallow script that lacks gripping screenplay, better execution and editing (it ticks for around 2 hours which is way too much considering the material offered to the audience) to hold the audience on any loose thread of it.

A fresh and welcomed return of Lara Croft to the big screen. The previous Tomb Raider/Lara Croft films seemed disjointed and slightly cartoonish. This time around, I believe we get a holistic look at who Lara Croft is and what drives her on.There is the occasional ?hiccup?, such as a nine year old tape recorder that plays without changing the batteries, but hey who carries spare batteries with them.Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed the revamped Tomb Raider. This film put meat on the bones of a franchise previously starved for ideas and has breathed life into the whole console game v?s big screen adaptation.Just wish someone somewhere would consider having a crack at the ?Uncharted? franchise. Seeing Nathan Drake on the big screen would be cool.Anyway, can?t wait to see the next instalment of Tomb Raider Mk 2

This is a really good movie. It sets up Lara Croft, beautifully crafts her as a normal day girl, Alicia Vikander only adds up to this beloved character, making her even more interesting and loveable. The action scenes are well put together, and different to what we are used to seeing in big screen spectacles, the action in this movie feels soulfull, with a heart pumping, they're powefull but then again simple. We can tell the C.G.I is there, but the built sets and the simplicity of the crafting of the action scenes take over any flaws. The father and daughter moments are touching and believable, it flows the story forward. I wish this movie had a better rating from critics, it truly makes me start thinking that it is purely prejudice against video game movies, as they all seem to bring the subject up, rather then just looking at the movie for what it is. A well acted, beautifully crafted and plotted action adventure, coming of age small flick, where not everything is perfect and shiny, but Alicia Vikander shines so bright like a diamond. Go see it...it's worth it.
Great film version of Tomb Raider. Alicia rocks as Lara Croft, and I would really like to see part 2! I hope this would become a start of a great franchise.

Being an enthusiastic fan of the Tomb Raider games, a movie that looked like it was pulled straight out of my favorite of the games had me nearly vibrating in anticipation. The trailers and teasers used scenes carefully chosen to mimic iconic 2013 Tomb Raider game moments, bursting with promises of an incredible live action debut of the fantastically written reboot of Lara Croft's story. The resulting movie, however, proved nothing more than a vast disappointment and a waste of two hours that would have served better in the game it was pretending to emulate.
Amazing performance by Alicia i love the movie she is young Lara and not that powerful but smart and brave.Full with action and good story for a first movie i will watch it again
Definitelty recommanded! Alicia simply kills it as Lara Croft! Hope for a sequel!
Awesome Reboot! Loved it!
Much better than the previous films and quite enjoyable
Alicia Vikander delivered an emotional and convincing performance, paired with accurate and nostalgic action sequences, this movie is a must see, especially for any true Tomb Raider fan.

That was fantastic. I thoroughly enjoyed that, especially after the disappointments that were the first two movie. This one makes the originals look like some cheap high school production.Alicia was PERFECT, everything that Jolie wasn't. Nice to see an actual fit and athletic looking Lara Croft, AND one that can actually throw a punch and kick without making you cringe at the terrible technique.Loved this movie, can't wait to see it again.Alicia Vikander IS Lara Croft.

Oooof. With such an enormous budget, what happened?! The importance of story telling has never been more important in a film!Where do we start? A storyline that's a mess, a rediculous plot, unrealized characters, uninteresting dialogue, colorless cinematic pallet, extremely slow paced, and... wait for it... underdeveloped action scenes, tension building and weak performances. Yes, even award winning actors deliver stiff performances and lack the chemistry needed to make this tolerable to watch. Forgivable for a 10M film. Not 90M.
WOW! This wasn't just a great video game film, it was a great action flick! Once you get past the bike chase scene the film takes off! Disappointed in the film industry to only score it 50% on here!

TOMB RAIDER entertains excellently through Alicia Vikander's powerful performance and fast, groundbreaking action in intricate, attentive depictions of the ocean and island even if the movie hardly has any plot written out and behaves very much like a live-action video game played out for you.

In 2013 square Enix did something smart -They realized the world is more aware and less naive, and realized a new version of Tomb Raider, a little more realistic and mature where the main character is brave but vernabl. A great original story.The movie creators made the same smart decision, following thia path and it pays off.The casting is the best achievement while Alicia is nothing less than fantastic and the story is intriguing, with solid action sequences.There are a few plot holes that prevent this picture beefing something really great, but still, its a fun ride to join.

Highly entertaining, action packed take on the Tomb Raider franchise. The actress playing the titular character did very well in the face of a fairly weak plot. That said, there have been FAR WORSE examples of films based on video games just in this franchise, let alone the whole video game movie genre. I ponied up for shake seats in the movie theater for this one and it did not disappoint. Brava, Lara Croft. 3.5 out of 5

You would enjoy Tomb Raider more if you lower your expectations and bring a controller. Every scene with Lara feels like a quick time event. Vikander was okay but the movie lacks a good story.

Ok, I was really impressed how the kept true the overall tomb raider games (roboot series). During the a lot action scenes, I was screaming in my head "push x!" or "oh shit, left trigger, right trigger!" As far as the story, I wouldn't say it pulled my heart strings or saw anything unexpected but good overall. If your a fan of the series or looking for a good action movie, this is a good one.
I loved it good story and good acting can't wait till number 2
I love this movie definitely BEST Tomb Raider movie. It is also my favorite video game movie ever!!!

I loved it! Absolutely phenomenal! Alicia Vikander kills as the new Lara Croft! This movie totally captures the essence of the new Tomb Raider games as well as nods to the classics! I can't wait to see it again!

This is easily the best movie adaptation of a video game in recent years. Lots of good action and a solid story. It doesn't follow the 2013 story because that would require a lot of bad CGI, but it does have some of the iconic moments. This is a fresh and original reboot that's worth seeing, especially if you're a fan of the franchise.

Lara remains the bad ass she always has been. Just like the reboots of the games, it just has better graphics than the previous ones made. She seems less of a super here (compared to Angelina) to more of an extremely fit everday girl who has bravery and wits like no other. Loved it. Bring me more!
Way below my expectation
I really like it,is a really good adventure movie and Alicia Vikander NAILED IT as Lara Croft

Disregard the TOMATOMETER, in this instance the audience score is far more telling. I've seen Tomb Raider several times now and I enjoy it more each time I see it. While it's not a perfect movie it is compelling and interesting. I think it's a shame that Rotten Tomatoes might discourage people from seeing this in theaters because it was truly a delight. If you are a fan of the games, you'll appreciate it all the better. But the beauty of this film is that you don't have to be a fan of the games to enjoy it. It stays true to the source material but doesn't forget that it's a movie and not a game, a mistake that many other adaptations have made in the past. I gave this movie 5 stars not because it was perfect but because it was enjoyable. And I think you'll enjoy it too if you get past the the TOMATOMETER and just experience it for yourself in theaters.

Enjoyed the movie far more than a 50% rating. Won't win an Oscar, but very entertaining. The only annoyance was the constant screaming. I am a Tomb Raider video game fan and she seemed whiny compared to Lara in the games. However, well worth seeing.
Love the action. It doesn't let up.. Great adventure a few good discoveries. What a great throw back to Indiana Jones!! What a ride.

From the preview I expected it to be exactly like the game it's based on. Turns out it's VERY loosely based on the game, and I mean very. That being said, it was still enjoyable and fun. I'll see the sequel if they make one for sure.
No shortage of action and great story telling in this big screen adaptation of the video game series Tomb Raider
Intense action/adventure film. Fan of Tomb Raider (the game) or not. It is amazingly entertaining.
I like this Tomb Raider reboot. The main character is much more likable then Angelina. Not sure why Critics are giving it bad reviews.

I enjoyed it quite a bit! As a fan of the video games, especially the most recent Rise of the Tomb Raider, I enjoyed Vikander's performance. I feel like she captured the grittiness of Lara Croft's character.

Spoiler Alert-this is poorly written. Laura Croft is supposed to be Smart and Athletic. They got this 1/2 right. She repeatedly makes dumb mistakes and is mentally weak! 4X she has the Villain Dead-to-rights and does NOTHING! She doesn't kill him when given the opportunity NUMEROUS times. She walks through his tent without him seeing her and she has a weapon. What does she do? Decides to go out looking for her buddy. WTH? She has an opportunity to push him over a cliff, into a cravats, off a platform, and shot him in the face. Does nothing...She leads the villain where he wants. Does what he wants. Seems to be more FOR him than against.Causes more problems and is down right foolish. This was excruciating to watch! Glad I didn't pay to see the 3D. It's a rental flick at best.
Great fun, much like the last two games. Lara Croft and Alicia Vikander are badass! Can't wait for the next one, make it bigger and better please. This was a great start.
Good movie if you have never played the games.
Good movie' nice history
I just saw it and enjoyed it a lot. A bit too fast but still enjoyable.

An action packed film, a plot worthy of the new Tomb Raider video games, Alicia captures the essence of Lara that we all know; a brave woman, intelligent but at the same time more human capable of making mistakes Definitely a film that no fan of Lara should miss!

I think this may be the best video game based movie that has come out in a while. It actually feels very much like Tomb Raider and Alicia vikander I feel portrays Lara Croft very well. I do feel that there were some opportunities missed and making her character a bit more well-rounded but overall I thought this was a very good movie. And it looks like the story going forward will be very exciting.

Tomb Raider was an enjoyable action movie with good effects and an interesting plot. Its dialogue was one of its only weaknesses, feeling slightly forced. Lara was grounded and relatable, however, almost every one of her decisions were reckless and stupid despite everyone telling her how smart she was. Overall, it was a good movie with mostly admirable qualities.

Being a fan of the game franchise it whisks you into the adventurous world of Laura Croft in the best way possible. The original adaptation was much more hollywood block buster while this feels like a simple "indiana jones" ish move. Much more grounded and although the world itself has to have unrealistic elements stays grounded in reality with the protagonist often getting hurt , disoriented, and tired. it knows what it is in terms of plot its simple but driven by the performance of Alicia Vikander. The villain kind of fell short in terms of depth but he still remained the dark part of the movie. Great fan service at the end, strong leading lady , and generally a fun movie.
Unnecessary, pointless, predictable and boring ... Alicia Vikander was great but this was rinse and repeat of the previous films ... not necessary a bad film but can't beat Indiana Jones ...

i WILL GO AS FAR TO SAY THIS IS A GOOD MOVIE. NOT A GREAT MOVIE, BUT IT'S GOOD. ENJOYABLE TO SAY THE LEAST. i WILL ALSO SAY THIS IS BETTER THAN THE ANGELINA JOLIE VERSIONS, AND WHILE THIS MOVIE HAS SOME FLAWS, THEY PALE IN COMPARISON TO THOSE. THIS MOVIE DEFINITELY FEELS MORE LIKE THEY WANTED TO BUILD OFF THE TOMB RAIDER (2013) REMAKE OF THE GAMES, AND THEY DID A GOOD JOB. IT HAD PLENTY OF ACTION, IT WAS FAST PACED (ALBEIT A BIT TOO FAST, BUT THAT'S REALLY JUST ME NITPICKING ON IT. SOME THINGS GO FAST BUT IF IT EXPLAINED MORE IT WOULD JUST ADD MORE TO THE OVERALL LENGTH OF THE FILM.)THE PLOT OF THE MOVIE IS VERY GENERIC. ALMOST LIKE THEY JUST DIDN'T TRY. FATHER GOES AWAY, SAYS HE WILL COME BACK, DOESN'T. DAUGHTER FOLLOWING IN THE "FAMILY FOOTSTEPS" SETS OFF TO FIND HIM. THEN STORY GOES FROM THERE. I DID LIKE THE ENDING THOUGH, LEFT OFF FOR A SEQUEL AND HAS A NICE TWIST. I DO LOVE ALICIA VIKANDER AS LARA CROFT. SHE PLAYS IT BEAUTIFULLY AND IS THE SAVING GRACE. HER CHARACTER WAS WELL DONE AND I LOOK FORWARD TO SEE HER CONTINUE THE ROLE.ALL IN ALL IT'S A SOLID MOVIE. I WOULD RECOMMEND TO SEE IT, BUT FROM REDBOX OR USING A MOVIEPASS.

Probably the best video game film adaptation yet !! It is very faithful to the rebooted game with adding some of its own twists to it so its not exactly like the game. I've read critic reviews and I believe that they are misinterpreting the new Lara Croft, mostly because Lara is desexualized and is made more grounded. Regardless great movie with great pace, character development, emotional attachments, and great action seauences. Highly recommended.

An excellent piece of entertainment! I really enjoyed this remake. It's fast-paced, great action sequences, and Alicia Vikander, who plays Lara Croft, is outstanding. Vikander is one of my favourite actors and she brings a believability to her performance and makes the story more grounded than the originals. Norwegian Roar Uthaug direction is spot on. I've taken 1/2 a star off for the inevitable plot holes. But who really cares when it's such a joy to watch. Check it out on the big screen. Can't wait for the next one.
Fantastic Tomb Raider reboot that has Alicia as Lara Croft. She's beautiful and is a great actress. Plenty of action and entertaining.
classic studio film but Alicia as craft is awesome and it was an enjoyable time!
NA
A good movie. Not bad, not great, but definitely enjoyable to watch.

La película de Tomb Raider (2018) no tenía mucho de tombs ni de raiders, pero aún así no fue un desastre. Fue disfrutable a pesar de no ser la gran cosa. Square Enix te odio. En fin, la película no creo que aburra a muchos, tiene acción, la Lara Crof está bastante decente, momentos entretenidos y algunos easter egg de los juegos que se disfrutan si eres fan de la saga (principalmente los dos últimos títulos). No creo que se le pueda pedir mucho más a una película de este estilo.Mi parte favorita fue el cameo de Nick Frost porque Nick es amor ?. Eso sí, probablemente la mejor adaptación de película a un videojuego, pero es re fácil, porque en general son todas basura.Tanto el juego Tomb Raider (2013) y el Rise of the Tomb Raider son superiores en todo aspecto. (JUEGAZOS ??)3/5.
A miserable parody of the Tomb Raider. Vikander is no Lara even a little. Don't waste your money for this piece of crap.

Sometimes you can't trust movie critics. I feel the movie was very well done. Alicia Vikander was an excellent Lara Croft, giving even Angelina Jolie a run for a money. It was highly entertaining and kept my interest throughout. People complained about the lackluster origin story and true, it could have really been expanded and built upon,but overall the movie was great. I highly recommend it.

I like it and i will buy the blu ray and watch it again , Alicia is awesome in this role. A lot of action , good story and realy good performance , she is young and i love that she is not overpowered she fight and kill for the first time and she got hurt a lot too...... i hope for a trilogy :)

Tomb Raider has all the elements one wants from a good videogame movie:the action,the great visual effects,the referendes to the game but also a solid plot that entertains and makes you care about the main characters just enough to be invested in their action throughout the entire film. Alicia Vikander is just AWESOME and BADASS as Lara Croft and mamages to bring that emotional layer that Jolie's perfomance lacked. Showing Lara Croft as a tormented and unexperienced young woman, before she was the tomb raided everybody knows, was a smart move that made the audience create a stronger bond with her.All in all Tomb Raider is a very good movie and easily the best video game movie so far in my opinion. Hopefully this was just the first chapter of a long saga that may very well represent the long awaited rebirth of the videogame genre.

A grounded reboot, based on the 2013 video game. Though extremely generic, this is a fun action flick and a faithful adaption of the game. Alicia Vikander as Lara Croft, she is wonderful in this role. She really does capture the attitude and heart of the video game character. She is so great in these action sequences, the fights and chases. Walton Goggins is an absolutely fantastic actor, but his character, this villain, is so generic and bland that any actor could have been plucked out for the role.This isn't a perfect film; the story at times and the dialogue can take you out of the film. There's an extremely unnecessary subplot with Daniel Wu's character, and the editing during the action sequences can be so jarring - 3 or 4 cuts per second. Today's age and what we see time and time again with certain directors, I can't help but be disappointed when blockbuster films such as this can't get the editing right. Some pretty good CGI though, and the video game aspects made me so happy, seeing them translated on screen with what today's technology can give us! The dungeon puzzles, the weapons, locations and battles - this film also includes a lot more violence and gore than I would have guessed.
Amazing movie! It Shows Lara Croft before being "Lara Croft" but with her essence. This movie is about the new reboot of franchise (2013). Truly fans will love this movie.

I am a huge fan of the 2013 Tomb Raider game and its sequel. So I was really looking forward to this incarnation of Lara Croft on the big screen. This movie did not disappoint. Don't go see it expecting Oscar caliber acting and writing! Go see for the love of the serial action genre and just fun action. I can't wait to see what else they do with this film in the future!

After all these years, Hollywood bringing to life so many game adaptations, but almost all of these movies failed miserably. And now, in 2018, the director, Roar Uthaug and Alicia Vikander bring to life THE best game adaptation. Of course, the movie plot is still simple and predictable BUT, don't forget the fact: The Tomb Raider games was never more than that! This movie is FUN, packed with good action, the visuals are great also the music. Most importantly, Alicia Vikander is Lara Croft! I follow her carrier from the begining, so I knew she's an amazing actress, but still, her performance is blow me away! In this movie, the villain is not just some random dude, who want's to rule the world. He has some good and solid opinions why he do what he do. Walton Goggins performance is top notch as always. The one thing I missing is her relationship with her family. I think with some more backstory he could be more relatable character.The father-daughter relationship was well written, but they used that flashback scene too much, I think. I don't wanna tell more because that will be a spoiler but if you curious, Dominic West was great and he's character had some surprising development.And the last thing I've missed is, more Daniel Wu scenes and character development. I hope, when they make a sequel, they will bring him back some more action.Lastly, if you wanna see some copy paste game adaptation, or just want to see boobs, this is not yours movie. BUT, if you like fun and thrilling movies with good drama, than, go and watch Tomb Raider!

"Tomb Raider" (PG-13, 1:58) is a reboot of the erstwhile Angelina Jolie franchise (with 2001 and 2003 "Lara Croft Tomb Raider" films). All the movies are based on the British "Tomb Raider" action-adventure video game series, which came on the scene in 1996. Like the games, the movies have used various combinations of "Tomb Raider" and "Lara Croft" (the franchises' central character) in their titles. Naming tweaks aside, the question is if the 2018 changes in casting & approach pay off for Movie Fans. While Jolie's casting and portrayal matched the look and attitude of the video game heroine, Oscar winner Alicia Vikander brings a leaner and less mean Lara Croft to the big screen. Jolie brought the bad-ass female archaeologist/adventurer to life with a lot of swagger, but Vikander's Croft is more physically and emotionally vulnerable, full of fight, but yet to realize her potential, intellectually or in practice. The quality both characterizations share is intelligence and guts, but 2018's "Tomb Raider" is an origin story.Seven years after the disappearance of her father, wealthy businessman and adventurer Lord Richard Croft (Dominic West), Lara is a woman with no plan. Obviously intelligent, she's content trying to be a mixed martial artist and working as a bicycle messenger. She wouldn't have to work at all, if she would just sign the documents declaring her father legally dead so she can inherit his company and his fortune, but she's having a very hard time letting go of the hope that her father, whom she idolizes, is still alive.When company officer (and Lara's former legal guardian), Ana Miller (Oscar nominee Kristin Scott Thomas), finally convinces Lara to swing by the office and sign those papers, Lara receives a Japanese puzzle box that her father left her. Solving the puzzle leads Lara to the discovery of what her father was really working on when he disappeared - trying to find the tomb of a legendary Japanese queen who supposedly possessed the power of life and death. Still hoping to find her father alive (or at least learn what happened to him), the clues lead Lara to Japan where she hires a reluctant but down-on-his-luck boat captain (Daniel Wu) to take her into the Devil's Sea to a remote island which is notoriously difficult to reach. Upon reaching the island, Lara discovers the ruthless Mathias Vogel (Emmy nominee Walter Goggins) leading an expedition to find the tomb for a mysterious international organization.Vikander's "Tomb Raider" (directed by Roar Uthaug) is a joyless, by-the-numbers actioner. In spite of Vikander's considerable talent and gravitas, she feels miscast as the tough and determined young adventurer. With the understanding that this is a Lara Croft origin story, it just becomes mind-numbing to see her beaten up throughout the movie, while none of the actors' performances rise about the level of serviceable. The script (by Evan Daugherty and Geneva Robertson-Dworet) features unnecessary dialog, characters whose motivations make little sense and a story which is mostly very predictable. Disappointing. "C"

Tomb Raider (2018) - Review The GoodAlcia Vikander is Lara Croft, she does not phone it in she doesn't speak much in certain scenes, but Vikander is such a great actress her body shows it. A way better Tomb Raider than Angelina Jolie who was basically a cartoon. It 100% nails the tone of the 2013 much better than this Video GameThe Action Sequences are surprisingly good and has pretty good visual effects for a Video Game movie.The Score is pretty goodThe BadIt feels Pretty long - The first act feels bloated of exposition and it takes 40 minutes just to get the damn island, in the game it took a few minutes. There was no reason why this was longer than 100 minutes.The biggest weakness is the script its Dull and Exposition heavy that has to explain everything to you, if you know the game you know this story, but they change certain things. The Supporting Cast is wasted - Dominic West is just there, Nick Frost is only in 2 scenes, Daniel Wu barely does anything. The biggest crime is Walton Goggins is a generic villain, its mostly a paycheck for these actors.Some emotional beats work and some don't If you seen the first trailer then you saw the obvious sequel bait ending with her in a ponytail and a gun with Nick Frost, so good job dumbass Marketing Overall: I think this is a good step into the right direction for Video Game Movies cause this is the closest one yet way better than a lot of video game movies Cough Shit Resident Evil CoughOverall Grade: C+

Over the years, many writers and directors have attempted to make solid films based on beloved video game franchises, but they've almost always failed. For that reason alone, the bar was already very low, so this review may need to be taken with a grain of salt. For what it's worth, Tomb Raider is easily one of the best adaptations ever made. It's riddled with many of the same issues that previous attempts have, but these movies need to have a sense of fun and adventure, which I believe this film provides. This movie isn't going to be remembered as great, but it will almost always be present when speaking about the best films to come from a video game. If you're a fan of the games or just want to have a fun (even if disposable) time at the movies, then here's why I will absolutely recommend Tomb Raider to you.It's many years after the disappearance of her father and Lara Croft sets out on a journey to find a tomb that has been a mystery for years. Being the island that her father reportedly died at, she's faced with the sadness of her past. Filled with energy and fun action set pieces, this film clicks along at a fairly brisk pace, even though it does drag in some areas. It tries very hard to accomplish an emotional core in order to win over its audience in the third act, and for the most part, it works. The emotional core is one of the more enjoyable aspects about Tomb Raider, due to the fact that the performances here are truly what elevates this film from mediocre to good.Alicia Vikander continuously reminds audiences around the world that she's an actress who will be around for a very long time and I have zero complaints about that. Her portrayal of Lara Croft is far better than what Angelina Jolie brought to the role many years ago and the sense of adventure and story itself is also on a much more mature level. From Walton Goggins as the core villain to the short amount of screen time that Dominic West has as Lara's father, I can't commend this film enough for trying very hard with its characters. That being said, the screenplay itself could've used a few tweaks.Yes, as you can see, I was pleasantly surprised during my experience of Tomb Raider, but it's not all sunshine and rainbows I'm afraid. The dialogue definitely feels streamlined at times, not leaving enough clues for the audience to figure out the puzzles. They choose to allow the characters on-screen to reveal the answers after they've figured them out in their heads. On top of that, the climax of this film places every character in an impossible situation and it felt like I was watching someone try to accomplish an impossible task in an adventure-based video game. If you can forgive that, then the climax can be quite entertaining, but it's also very ridiculous and out of place when comparing it to the rest of the movie.In the end, Tomb Raider definitely won't make any top ten lists for 2018, nor will it be remembered as a great movie, but it's without question one of the best adaptations from a video game that's ever been made. It's not without a few glaring issues and the dialogue can be slightly generic and cringe-worthy at times, but I'd be lying if I didn't call this a fun adventure flick with some terrific and devoted performances all around. For action junkies or fans dying to see a decent adaptation for once, I feel no shame in recommending this one. I'm happy to say that this isn't a bad film and I would actually love if they're able to make a sequel. That may not be saying much for some people, but that seems like a fairly strong statement to me.

Don't listen to the critics if you're looking for a great adventure. If you lack imagination and have no interest in character development and puzzles, then don't see it. Alicia does a phenomenal job of capturing Lara, and adds a tremendous amount of depth while showing us how Lara becomes a hardened and skilled Raider. I loved seeing the small moments that have huge impacts on her and why she is the character we love. The things that happen and how she responds - is so real. I could completely identify with the inner conflicts she faces and that instantly made it more compelling to watch. Well filmed. Nothing overtly CGI. A few cheesy moments, but hey, this is entertainment. Not everyone wants to see depressingly accurate portrayals of circumstance. We're talking about booby traps and tombs people.... let yourself get lost in your imagination and enjoy the ride ;)

Overall this movie compliments the video game more than it copies it. As other reviewers have noted, if you played the recent prequel game than you have played through versions of this film which are nearly shot by shot live action remakes from the game. But I felt like overall the movie added a lot of value to the game more than competing against it. The first hour of the movie adds lots of exposition to the game to explain who Lara Croft was before the Tomb Raider, and who her family was. There is a lot of actually very interesting stuff in the first half of the movie that you do not get in the games and adds a lot of value to the games. About an hour in we get to the point where the video game starts (the shipwreck), which begins about another 30 minutes of shot by shot replication from the game (with one major change from the game's premise). Finally we get about 10 minutes of conclusion to the Tomb which wasn't in the game, an then the last 15 minutes of the movie tends to wrap up the story and mainly lead us to the other movie, showing how she turned into the Lara Croft that Angelina Jolie plays. So as you can see, the movie added a lot of value to the game, emphasising the parts of the medium that the movie is good at (storytelling) while the game offers more of the action sequences that games are good for. I feel like this is a great compliment of the medium and the game and the movie work very well together. Overall I think this is my favorite of the Tomb Raider movie series, and hope to see more in the future.

What a great movie this was. A true breath of fresh air, unlike all the politically correct rubbish being churned out of late, this story really takes you on a journey. Now as usual the critics don't know a good movie if it slapped them in the face and I feel it's because they still have no clue on how to rate action as a genre and have little understanding of all the great things this movie did to reboot the franchise. Alicia Vikander is such a scraper in this film, she really has you caring for both her character and her cause, with an enjoyable heroes journey, rather than a Mary sue skip to the finish. Some may say this makes the story predictable, which I say, "the tomb raider, raided a tomb. Wtf were your expectations?" Now here is the action breakdown, where there scenes that were badass? Yes, congratulations this is indeed a good film. I personal can't wait for the next instalment of this saga.

This is an origin story of Lara Croft, borrowing quite heavily from the rebooted 2013 game and the sequel, Rise of the Tomb Raider. in terms of action sequences Alicia Vikander absolutely nails it as Lara Croft bringing an emotional depth to the character, while also proving to be quite the action star. She worked hard for this role and it shows. The action scenes are tense, with a Lara who seems to be winging it much of the time, hoping for the best, while growing into her skills,and confidence. The film takes a more realistic route, while not taking itself too seriously, with a touch of humour to balance things out a little. My only real criticism is that the pacing near the end, once Lara escapes the tomb, felt a tad rushed. A must see for Tomb Raider and Alicia fans, and also if you like a good action adventure movie

Really Good. It will be interesting to see if follows the story of Rise and how it might bring in the more fantastical elements of the game.

Despite the harsh reviews, I really enjoyed the film. Although the script was awfully cliche at times and the story could have been developed further, they stayed true to the game, blending the 2013 reboot's Himiko storyline and Rise of The Tomb Raider's Trinity focus well. Cinematography was one of the highlights of the film, as was Vikander's performance. It was fun, didn't bore me a bit. A great video game adaptation.

Nobody expected this to succeed. Alicia Vikander gives it her all but the story is too thin. However, there was enough momentum in the first and third acts for people to enjoy. It is better the Da Vinci Code series but less so than the stupidly fun National Treasure.
Not the best but still not the worst I give it a solid 7 out of / 10
The movie was well made , and very fun. It was a nice introduction to the Character of Lara croft. Pleanty of action in the right spots. Well done.
human, emotional and adventurous, enjoyed it

4/5 As far as video game adaptations go, this is a damn good one. I'd rank in right up there with Silent Hill ass one of my favorites. While the movie doesn't quite follow the story of the game, it has enough of the elements and little nods to make you go "oh, that's just like in the game." Complete with a great performance from Alicia Vikander, I'd say this is a huge step in the right direction for video game adaptations.

Tomb Raider is a somewhat faithful adaptation of the recent 2013 video game of the same name. The cast of the movie are all great as the characters they play. The visual effects and CGI are noticeable at times but they don't pop and demand your attention. Someone just enjoying the movie will not notice it. The story of the movie is understandable but it definitely could've been done better. The score and other music in the movie is well used. Overall it's a really good and fun action movie.

I can see how people who have never played "Tomb Raider Definitive Edition" or "Rise of the Tomb Raider" would give this film a poor rating. For me, as an avid fan of both games, I appreciate how they recreated so much of the games sequences, but also how they made a very enjoyable film version that is appealing for a broader audience. Alicia makes for an amazing Lara, she's strong and capable, but also vulnerable and you feel excited to be part of her journey. People who are comparing the movie to the game and expecting the first to be an exact copy of the later are just crazy.

Not going to lie, I thought this movie was going to be mediocre-godawful. I loved the game it was based off of, the reboot that square enix did(look it up, its amazing). This movie was solid, it had some very visceral action sequences.. it also had some reminders that "hey this is a video game superhero" because she def should have died or been paralyzed by a few things haha. That suspension of disbelief at moments was the only thing I knocked it a star for. Go see it, its a legit action flick, and she kills the role...shame on you jolie...shame lol
It was a really fun movie and really felt like the games on edge powerful tension.
Alicia Vikander is great in this, I also loved the action, 5 stars from me.
Surprisingly good and exhilarating.

I really enjoyed Tomb Raider, much more than i expected to. It's a fun throwback to the old Indiana Jones movies, with some great action and set pieces. But it's really Alicia Vikander that sells this thing . Her Lara Croft is more real, more vulnerable than the Angelina Jolie characterization. She is not a superhero, but a human being who makes mistakes, gets injured and really feels like she is in way over head, which adds stakes to her journey. And Alicia is such a talented actress, bringing so much nuance to the role that it is hard to keep your eyes off her. I hope that people give this film a shot, and that it ends up generating sequels. I want to see more of Alicia Vikander as Lara Crioft!

I was excited to see Alicia Vikander as Lara Croft and Daniel Wu as Lu Ren, the supporting actor... Despite their performances, the movie was disappointing. The plot was straightforward and dull with forcefully added "exotic" moments where the enslaved island workers tried to communicate with Wu in cantonese with a weird accent. At the beginning of the movie, the representation of Hong Kong was outrageous; from the string of little red lanterns at the back of the cab to the "fishing village" in Aberdeen. If the director chose to show the present modern image of London in the movie, there seemed to be either a mismatch of time or Croft didn't only travel to Hong Kong, but also time travelled back to the 80s to search for Lu Ren and his boat albeit showing an equally present aerial shot of Hong Kong before all the nonsense happen.All in all, glad to see a diverse mix of actors and actress in the movie and Vikander's Lara Croft was not objectified in the movie.
Second rate plot and dialog, some shoddy acting..sadly it met the expectations that the trailer set for me. Alicia Vikander was not the problem though.
Not sure why reviews are so split on this, because the movie is actually pretty good.
Is the new Tomb Raider merely a Japanese-themed version of Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade? Yes. It is still very well acted, entertaining. It knows exactly what it wants to be and delivers on it.

A pretty average action film. Based on the 2013 reboot video game Tomb Raider this movie stars the excellent Alicia Vikander stars as Lara Croft who in this version is a bike courier hiding from her past. After her father Richard Croft (Dominic West) goes missing 7 years in the past Lara lives life not knowing what happened to him. One day when Lara is about to inherit all of her fathers fortune she uncovers a puzzle he left for her which leads her to a secret room where an old video of Richard reveals what he was last working on. This leads Lara across the globe where she hires a boat captain named Lu Ren (Daniel Wu) to take her to a mysterious island off the coast of Japan. There Laura and Lu discover a man named Mathias Vogel (Walton Goggins) who works for a mysterious group called Trinity that is trying to discover the secrets of the islands. Soon enough it's up to Laura stop Mathias and discover what her father died trying to prevent! So first off the movie does pay a lot of homage to the 2013 game and even has a pretty loose plot following it, but it does fall quite s bit flat. Lu is an unnecessary character and I felt like they should have used the original character he's slightly based on from the game instead for a more emotional connection to Laura. The bad guy here isn't bad and they even try to make him a humane character by having relatable goals, but for me it never worked here. I will say I did enjoy Alicia Vikander as Laura and hope if there's sequels she gets to develop the character even more. The dialogue in this film is sometimes so hammy and atrocious it takes away from the film. some CG isn't the greatest, but for the most part a majority of it looks great. The action is pretty intense, but it still had a slightly anti-climatic ending. Overall, I would say it's worth a rent if you're a fan of the series. Vikander does well here and works with what she's got. Anyone else not a fan should probably steer clear.
Tomb Raider is everything a Video Game based movie should be. You find yourself on the edge of your seat with the suspense and anxiety that comes with this fast-paced action flick.

It was a great concept and story the actress I cannot remember her name at the moment was great throughout the whole movie with her emotional connection to the text the score was spot on and mixed very well and the cinematography was good. The bad is there are some clique moments and also visual effects need a little touch up other than that great great movie
Excellent, faithful to the tomb raider reboot and the original. Alicia Vikander is a superb young Lara. Impatiently awaiting the sequel!!

What is immediately recognizable in this film is the quality of the performances. The emotions and responses are refreshingly organic and believable. This is an action film that earns every step it takes. It was great seeing Lara's journey. Her transformation from traveller to survivalist to adventurer is well-done. The action is great. This is a must-see for fans of the rebooted games and those yearning for a classic adventure tale with some modern touches.

I liked this version with Alicia Vikander because the director kept it more realistic of a female in action versus Angolie's version which was more cartoonish and too commercial. Laura Croft in this version didn't always beat up everybody and found easy ways to escape. This Croft was more realistic and convincing of bravery rather than simple butt kicking throughout the movie. I give it 4 stars.

If you enjoy the video games by square eqix you will love this movie. Lara is at a crossroads in her life and she refuses to believe her father is dead, but is pressured to sign the paperwork, instead she takes of on an adventure to find him. The movie has the feel of the games, but it has its own unique story and I have no complaints about the acting, storyline, or cinematography. I was enthralled and on the edge of my seat. Great movie can't wait to see the next movie!

I thought the movie was pretty great! I keep stopping myself from saying amazing because though I don't think it was a perfect attempt it was EXACTLY what I wanted. Acted perfectly and as absurd as it needed to be to match the thrill of the games that fans LOVE SO MUCH. Go see this film!

Achievement unlocked! They managed to make the Jolie movies look halfway decent!Wasting the rich material they can draw from, Hollywood yet again dumbs it down for casual audiences - all in the name of "world building" and setting up the franchise for multiple entries down the line. You had one job, Hollywood. You just needed to follow the rebooted game's formula. And you still mucked it up. And who tf wrote the shitty screenplay?! How on earth did this project get greenlit?!You wasted Vikander's talent on shoddy scenario direction, a pedestrian script, and bland cinematography.I never write movie reviews during my free time, yet here we are.It's another case of a good game gone bad movie. ????
True to the story it was based off. Fun, engaging, entertaining. Won't win any awards but worth a watch and a must watch for fans of the franchise.

True to the game it was based from, Tomb Raider is action packed and intense all the way throughout. This movie is pleasantly exaggerated just enough to match that of the video game. Alicia does an excellent job portraying a naive and innocent Lara Croft. This movie was done with enough care that a sequel is almost guaranteed. And well deserved.
Vikander is outstanding! Tomb Raider all in all is an enjoyable and action-packed thrill ride with spirit; well worth the watch in theaters and a great start to the reboot!!

So it's not a bad movie but it's not great ether. The problem is tomb raider is a 40hr game. It's not impossible but it's pretty damn hard. High lights were seeing ur favorite scenes done on the big screen. The cast was good Lara croft was great but she's a academy award winning actress and she put a lot of work in to the character. So is it worth seeing yah but maybe matinee or 1sr screening. As far as video game movies go it's one of the best but thats not saying much.
BEST VIDEO GAME MOVIE TO DATE !
Not a huge disappointment, but with no original ideas or vision and cliches atop other cliches it just barely makes it into the "passable" category.

It was better than I expected. I wasn't expecting much. Alicia gave a good performance and they incorporated elements from the game in a reasonable way. If you're a Tomb Raider fan then you shouldn't miss this film.
It was an enjoyable movie to watch. There were parts that were lacking but overall, for a movie based off of a video game, they didn't muck it up too much to where it is unwatchable.

Tomb Raider is a good start to what hopefully becomes a perfect trilogy. We get a nice origin story with a character that is realistic and deals with issues that make her doubt herself and finds the ability to overcome hardships. The action scenes are filled with excitement. The violence more brutal than I expected considering the rating. All good things for a character like Lara Croft who has been a staple is the video world.

This movie had no idea what it was doing. When I saw it there was no reminants of the game they got lots of information wrong and cut out a huge portion of story. over all it wasn't really a good movie It mostly made me want to play the video game
This is the best Tomb Raider Movie since 2001 flim! I don't care it's SUCKED!

Effective, entertaining and a solid start. This new Tomb Raider is full of clichês of the genre, but still works most of the time, Alicia Vikander is excellent as the title role of Lara Croft and sequence of actions are more fun that you could hope for. (3,5/5)

"Tomb Raider"? More like "Disney Princess in the Forest". Horribly generic and boring, Vikander is completely miscast as "Lara Croft". Designed to please Social Justice Warriors while spitting in the face of millions of fans, it doesn't even make a good chick flick. Square Enix have allowed political correctness to destroy this once beloved icon. Any positives comments you read about this film is political bias, because, as a film, this is terrible from top to bottom.
It was alright, still think Tom Holland's uncharted will be better.
So much fun. I might go see it again.

As someone who has played both reboot games, my expectations were mixed.I knew on a 90 million dollar budget they weren't going to be able to give us more of the video game, However, That's not to say the team behind this movie weren't going to figure out how give us alot of that Lara I came to love from the hours of moving her through puzzle after puzzle and danger after danger.Alicia Vikander has all the physical tools and she displayed them in this movie.I could tell from some of the scenes she really put her body through some tough moments to give us that shot.As I sat through the movie, Alicia's Lara grew more and more on me.I could tell she's a woman who had played the games and wanted to do justice to the part and for that I am thankful.I appreciate the plot twist in regards to Himiko and I feel Walton Goggins has the face for Mathias. Walton always has looked like someone who escaped the looney bin and Mathias needed that look to sell the part so thumbs up for casting Walton.So yeah. Really good action movie with a solid foundation from the game. 4 stars and here is to hoping it makes enough money to greenlight a sequel with double the budget so we can get 'Rise of' with more justice done.
it's amazing! I love Alicia playing Lara! I love the director of the movie and the production of art! but the script could be better
The Movie is so Intense, With full of Intense moment, and so unpredictable. But
That was way better than expected! Awesome!

I liked it. It was nice to go see a movie that wasn't so politically charged and was made to entertain.This version of Laura Croft is a young vulnerable one who is strong, smart and determined. It was a lot of fun to watch on her progress on screen.Not a perfect movie but definitely worth the watch in theaters. I gave it five stars because it deserves much better than the %50 it has on rotten tomatoes.

If you have played the games, you will love this movie! If not - maybe. There are many moments that pay homage to the games - where if you don't get the references you might think they're using unnecessary camera angles, or nonsensical action, etc. If you do get the references, it's brilliant.

A strong re-boot. I love Alicia as the new Lara. I feel like the Jolie movies focused more on Lara being a Sex-symbol when she is clearly so much more. She is strength, intelligence and a role model for women. This new movie really portrayed that for me. While the movie isn't identical to the 2013 game it certainly has some matching elements and lots of non stop action.I'd see it again!
all audience on my row went to washroom during the talking plot

It was better than the average video game movie. The dialogue was average, but the actions sequences and sheer coolness of seeing Alicia Vikander pull off the Lara Croft stunts had everyone in the cinema cheering.
I really want to see Lara in action. Cause I love tomb raider games, this movie have potential

Watched this splendid piece of cinematography today in an IMAX cinema, and was blown away by the action, great acting, and amazing visual and sound effects! Cannot recommend this movie more and I must say, that this might be one of my favorite movies yet. Hoping for a second one.

Went into the movie optimistic it would mesh the mythology of the characters from the game as well as a grounded realityru and am delighted to say that I left the cinema very happy. Don't really see what people are being negative about the movie for, yes it's not going to win an Oscar but it delivers exactly what it intends, an adventure with a fantastic lead female and good supporting cast. The stakes feel real, the story is great and sucks you in to want to know what happens to our heroine next, roll on the sequel. If resident evil got 5 Movies by spitting out garbage then in comparison Tomb Raider should get at least 1 sequel. My rating is 9/10 simply because it ended! Will definitely watch again!

Based on the most recent run of Tomb Raider video games comes this new and improved Tomb Raider film which grounds the adventures of Lara Croft closer to reality than Angelina Jolie's 2001 adaptation. The story follows a pre-tomb raiding Lara Croft (Alicia Vikander) who after a shock discovery decides to venture towards her missing father's last known location and uncover the secrets about what happened to him. I honestly didn't have the highest of expectations going into this film as the trailers were decent but not incredible. It all hinged on whether the film could emulate a similar feel to the Square Enix video game which is very action packed and exciting. And thankfully I feel like this adaptation exhibits the tone of the Tomb Raider video games very well and has formulated a story that works for the big screen. There is an absolute tonne of fun to be had here, the story itself may be very paint-by-numbers all the way through but there's plenty of tense action sequences, puzzle solving and thrilling chase sequences to keep you invested.I need to kick this off by highlighting the incredible Alicia Vikander and her fantastic performance as a very strong and believably capable Lara Croft who I may even prefer over Jolie. She has a certain charm about her that makes her a likeable protagonist and can also pull out the survival skills when she needs to and kick some ass. She has a very charismatic, determined, and strong-willed personality and overall she's just a very well fleshed out character who we see only get stronger with each passing moment. And when you have someone as immensely talented as Alicia Vikander it only enhances every one of her scenes as she proves here time and time again she can do the dramatic and emotional just as well as she can pull off action sequences convincingly. As far as villains go, Walton Goggins plays Mathias Vogel and he is great because he just has one of the most punchable faces in cinema and that is no different here. For the most part he plays a pretty generic villain with a simple goal in mind but Goggins does bring a certain level of charisma to the role that sparks some life in him. They do briefly try to flesh the character out a little more and give him a bit of a loose backstory for some added depth but it's never fully delved into.Daniel Wu plays Lu Ren, someone who assists Laura on her journey and for his limited screen time he's decent in the role. The problem with his character is he doesn't really have much to do over the course of the film so when the story does occasionally check in with him it's more of a distraction than it is intriguing.The story itself as I've mentioned is very generic, I mean, you can probably lay out beat for beat the entire series of events by the end of the first act, and that has nothing to do with knowing the events of the game as this takes a large number of liberties. But also the fact that it's very generic doesn't necessarily mean that it's bad as the action sequences and constant fast moving pace keep up the excitement level and I was very much invested for the majority of the last two acts. I left actually surprised at how thrilling some of the action-adventure sequences are and how well they are filmed to where I was genuinely on the edge of my seat for a number of moments. There are a handful of moments where the CGI isn't completely up to scratch and it's momentarily noticeable but I mean, due to the amount of fun I was having I barely took notice of it. As far as the tone goes it takes itself pretty seriously and isn't constantly going for the joke, which I think worked for the story. It feels a lot like the Tomb Raider game (which is obviously good) and even Uncharted at times without Nathan Drake's smartassery outlining every scene. There's one, maybe two moments where it does go for the joke unsuccessfully and it doesn't need to because it goes against the tone established early on.So overall I'm glad to say I enjoyed almost all of this Tomb Raider origin story reboot and had a tonne of fun from beginning to almost end. It does something with its final moments which I really wish it didn't do because it's extremely unnecessary and it doesn't have much of a bearing on the story being told within this film. It's disappointing they decided to close it off how they did but the rest of the movie can still be very much enjoyed. Alicia Vikander I can't stress enough about how great she is in the role and proved everyone who was doubting her ability to play Lara Croft convincingly very wrong. Video game movies have constantly struggled to adapt the game's story into a movie suitable format, and I'd say Tomb Raider has cemented itself as one of the better ones and well worth the watch.6.8/10

After searching so many years for a good video game adaptation film, finally Tomb Raider comes along. For those who have played the recent games Tomb Raider 2013 and Rise of the Tomb Raider there are plenty of moments, beats, segments and nods to get you excited. I went to see it with a friend who hadn't played the new games and enjoyed it as much as i did. As always with newer films there gives us lots of bread crumbs for the potential sequel, which i'm hoping happens. Ignore the critics on this one and make up your own mind. I'll be going again soon. A great movie and Alicia IS Lara Croft
